definitions.body: :Jos 9:5 sandal, shoe (NH id.; Ar. na9lun id. (also horse-shoe, etc.); Syr. na9lo0 appar. only horse-shoe (rare; also NS) PS:2405; cf. poss. Eth. n9lt: (obsol.) wife of Levirate marriage Di:676);—abs. ´[[נ]] Ge 14:23, [[נׇ֑עַל]] De 25:10; sf. [[נַעֲלִי]] Ps 60:10, Ps 108:10, [[נַעַלְְ]] Jos 5:15, etc.; du. [[נַעֲלָָיִם]] Am 2:6, Am 8:6; pl. [[נְעָילִם]] Is 11:15, Ct So 7:2, [[נְעָלוֹת]] Jos 9:5; sf. [[נְעָלֶיְ]] Ex 3:5, Ez Eze 24:17, [[נְעָלָיו]] Is 5:27, [[נְעָלֵינוּ]] Jos 9:13, [[נַעֲלֵיכֶם]] Ex 12:11, Ez Eze 24:23; —sandal Ju Jdg 9:13, Am 2:6, Am 8:6 (du. = pair of sandals; mentioned as of little worth); De 29:4; on ([[ב]]) feet Jos 9:5 (JE), 1Ki 2:5, Ez Eze 24:23, Ex 12:11 (P); cf. [[פְּעָמַיִךְ בַּנְּעָלִים]] Ct So 7:2, ´[[וְהִדְרִיךְ בַּנ]] Is 11:15; put on sandal is [[בְּרֶגֶל]] ´[[שִׂים נ]] Ez Eze 24:17; loose the sandal is [[חָלַץ]] Is 20:2, De 25:9 cf. v:De 25:10; [[שַׁל]] (Imv.) Ex 3:5 (E), Jos 5:15 (JE); [[שָׁלַף]] Ru 4:7, Ru 4:8 (cf. Burton:Midian ii. 197); sandal-thong is [[שְׂרוֹךְ]] Ge 14:23, Is 5:27; [[עַל־אֱדוֹם אַשְׁלִיךְ נַעֲלִי]] Ps 60:10 upon Edom do I cast my sandal = Ps 108:10, denotes either contempt (Hup; [[עַל]] = unto, fig. of slave), or taking possession of (Fl in De, Che Bae), ‖[[מוֹאָב סִיר רַחְחִי]] favoursformer.—On symbolic use of sandal v. further Goldziher:Abh. z. Arab. Philol. i. 47 f. Jacob:Arab. Dicht. iv. 23.
